_header: Jesu that would after midnight / Thy sweet face that was so bright
Note:
Inserted in the Cursor
Mundi (3474), lines 25487-25618.
_description: The Hours of the Cross — in 6-line stanzas(aabccb)

BodFair14.First Lines:
Ihesus þat walde ofter midniȝtþi squete face
                    þat was sa briȝt…
BodFair14.Last Lines:
…& gif vs þe ioye for euermareþat þou to vs
                    has boȝt
BodFair14.Attributed Title:
Matinis of þe cros (f. 110ra), Atte laudis (f.
                        110ra), etc.
BodFair14.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Cursor Mundi.
EETS
         o.s. 57 (1874); repr. 1961; 59 (1875); repr. 1966; 62 (1876); repr.
            1966; 66 (1877); repr. 1966; 68 (1878); repr. 1966; 101 (1893); repr. 1962: 1458-67.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 39-44.

BLCottVesAIII.First Lines:
Ihesu þat wald efter mid nightÞi suete face þat was
                    sa bright…
BLCottVesAIII.Last Lines:
…And giue us ioi for euermareÞat þou us vnto boght.
                    Amen

GottingenTheo107.First Lines:
jhesu þat wald efter midnightþi suete face þat was
                    sua bright…
GottingenTheo107.Last Lines:
…And giue vs ioy for euermareþat þu vs to boght
                    Amen
GottingenTheo107.Note:
Twenty-one stanzas, often repeating ‘b’ in subsequent
                    stanzas.
